content.markdown:
## Trilogy Studio Demo Dashboard

Trilogy Studio a SQL-ish-centric analytics tool w/ a custom language - [Trilogy](https://trilogydata.dev/). This dashboard is based on a demo model - using a TPC model - to show off some features. 

Note: You may have landed on this in fullscreen mode; Click 'Edit' in the top right to escape into the general IDE if so inclined. You can then access a general tutorial.

But first, some charts: we're looking at {order_id_count} orders from customers in {order_customer_nation_id_count} countries, ordering parts from suppliers in {part_supplier_nation_id_count} nations.

Click around a little and have some fun! See if you can successfully edit the dashboard; apply a global filter; maybe find the model store and import some other fun datasets to explore.

1.content:
# Selecting total revenue
# Total revenue is based on the extended price minus discount
select 
    local.total_revenue,
    sum(quantity) as total_items_sold,
    count(order.id) as total_orders,
    count(order.customer.id) as total_customers  ;
1.name: Headline Metrics

5.content:
# Selecting the best selling products based on total revenue
select 
    part.id as product_id, 
    part.name, 
    total_revenue 
having 
    total_revenue > 0 
order by 
    total_revenue desc
limit 15;
5.name: Chart 5

6.content:
# This query selects the count of local.id 
# for each country, representing items sold to each country. 

select 
    order.customer.nation.name, 
    sum(quantity) as items_sold 
having 
    items_sold > 0;
6.name: Sales By Country

7.content:
# Query to get total sales by supplier 
# Total sales is calculated as the extended price minus discount

select 
    part.supplier.nation.name, 
    count(part.supplier.id) as nation_supplier_count,
    total_revenue
having total_revenue > 0 
order by
    total_revenue desc
;
7.name: Supplier Info

8.content:
select 
    order.customer.nation.region.id as region_id,
    order.customer.nation.region.name,
    count(order.id) as order_count,
    sum(order.total_price) as total_sales 
where 
    order.customer.nation.region.id is not null;
8.name: Chart 8

9.content:
select
  order.date.month_start,
  part.supplier.nation.name,
  sum(local.revenue) as monthly_revenue;
9.name: Revenue Trends
